Class MoveUtils.Line

java.lang.Object
engine.forBoard.MoveUtils.Line
Enclosing class:
MoveUtils
public static class MoveUtils.Line extends Object
The Line class represents a sequence of integer coordinates forming a line on the chess board. It is used to manage and store sequences of coordinates for move generation, particularly for sliding pieces like bishops, rooks, and queens that can move along directional lines.

This class provides methods for adding coordinates to the line and retrieving the complete line.

Author:
Aaron Ho

  • Field Details

    • coordinates

      private final List<Integer> coordinates
      The list of coordinates that make up this line. Each coordinate represents a square on the chess board that forms part of the continuous line.

  • Constructor Details

    • Line

      public Line()
      Creates a new Line instance with an empty list of coordinates. The line can then be populated with coordinates using the addCoordinate method.

  • Method Details

    • addCoordinate

      public void addCoordinate(int coordinate)
      Adds a coordinate to the line. Coordinates are added in sequence to form a continuous line on the chess board, representing possible move destinations for sliding pieces.
      Parameters:
      coordinate - The coordinate to be added to the line.

    • getLineCoordinates

      public int[] getLineCoordinates()
      Retrieves the list of coordinates in the line as an array. This method converts the internal list representation to an array for easier consumption by move generation code.
      Returns:
      The array of coordinates that form this line.

    • isEmpty

      public boolean isEmpty()
      Checks if the line is empty (contains no coordinates). This is useful for determining if a line has any valid moves or destinations.
      Returns:
      true if the line is empty, false otherwise.
